title: We need a logo! (now closed)
body:
# Challenge

Who has some design chops and wants to make us a cool logo?

Solidity has a logo, but we're cooler so we should have a better one!

P.S. we :hearts: you Solidity

---
# Rules

If you have a submission, post it to this issue as an embedded image (hosted from wherever you animals host things) and whomever has the most :+1:'s wins the bounty! Anyone can vote on submissions !

Challenge ends with our beta release (currently June 1st), where the winning submission will be added as a PR to our README/docs.

Closing Date: 1st June 2018

NOTE: Please do not submit a PR yet! Add your submission as a comment below!

NOTE: Please nothing offensive. Keep it clean, Vyperinos!

NOTE: Keep it original. As pointed out in the comments existing Vyper logos do already exist. Please refrain from making them look too similar, we don't want to get involved in any copy infrigement battles :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:  

NOTE: Please also see [Ethereum Branding Guidelines](https://www.ethereum.org/images/logos/Ethereum_Visual_Identity_1.0.0.pdf)

---
# Sponsors

SNT bounty sponsored by Status (https://openbounty.status.im).
ETH Bounty sponsored by @jacqueswww and myself
Feel free to add more bounties if you desire! ETH/ERC20/ERC223 accepted

---
# Brainstorming and Comments

Feel free to add notes with your concepts of what Vyper is and brainstorm concepts.

My design keywords (just for brainstorming):
* Snek (obvs)
* Sharp
* Secure
* Emerald
* Friendly

And some additional insperation: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TSqVXVXVjiVxH5COXgIu90_dSJTQv3_Ka-aI6MYqeIo

NOTE: Anyone can add a comment here just chatting about the designs or whatnot. Official entries should just contain the picture (optionally some comment about it) and are voted on ONLY using :+1:

What an interesting issue! Here is mine. I have inspired by the logo of [Solidity](https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/logo.svg) and [VENOM Vulnerability](http://venom.crowdstrike.com/).

Balance: 0.2 ETH
Tokens: SNT: 1000.00
Contract address: [0x780292713a8c44339b544c5e86ec6ac49dccdcdc](https://etherscan.io/address/0x780292713a8c44339b544c5e86ec6ac49dccdcdc)
Network: Mainnet
Status: Pending maintainer confirmation
Winner: jacqueswww
Visit [https://openbounty.status.im](https://openbounty.status.im) to learn more.

Here's a quick simple concept can mess with the colors or add serif

![Viper logo concept](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jtlacci/Misc/8d6f49cc/Viper-logo.png)

edit1: more and less 'solidified' versions

![Viper logo concept 2](https://rawgit.com/jtlacci/Misc/master/Viper-logo2.png) ![ViperLogo 3](https://rawgit.com/jtlacci/Misc/master/Viper-logo3.png)

Here's my go. I like that @JisuPark tried to pay homage to the Solidity logo, and like the consistency that that creates, so I tried to incorporate that in my design. Also [‚àÜ](https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/1393965/are-triangles-the-strongest-shape) conveys security/strength. Made it green because üêç

SVG in [Vyper.svg.zip](https://github.com/ethereum/vyper/files/1953818/Vyper.svg.zip)

I like the idea of an Ethereum logo at the center of a snake eye. Threw this together quickly, but down to make a nicer/cleaner version if people are interested!

![vyperv1-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9343483/39346520-91f1fa50-49bc-11e8-8c6d-c96a3865162d.png)

I am not a designer so just posting here some ideas here for the designers to use.

Maybe we can make something similar to this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10667901/39360079-64b24360-4a25-11e8-9a87-8e7b9de414af.png)

But with a few changes:
1. Green snake, I think one of these colors #2CBD9A #B0E744 59982f can be good.
2. No background of course
3. Maybe flipping the snake so the head is to the right (mirror)
4. Make the snake look more calm and not like he's about to bite
5. I think we can make the snake fit to the gap in the Ethereum logo and make it look like it's wrapping it but still looks like a V.
6. Make the snake teeth look like the bottom part of the ethereum logo.
@ben-kaufman 5. would be sickkkk

What do you think about that? Keep in mind that this is just a sketch and I am not a designer, if the feedback is good enough I will give a it to a designer to make it look professional. Cheers :)
![vyper](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10667901/39372337-baa09584-4a4c-11e8-9190-280339c3a75e.png)

![asset 4black](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672810/39391645-0358d598-4a75-11e8-937d-babb20dfd162.png)


Proper versions of the Ethereum branding are hard to find!  The official logomark font is not actually listed anywhere and I had to do some real sleuthing to locate it (It's Print Clearly by the way).  I used the existing Ethereum branding (Solidity, Whisper, Ethereum and Swarm) as a guide for this new logo which takes the shape of a V with two cut outs (snake fangs!) and a geometric pattern which is similar to a snake's scales (and also reminiscent of the Ethereum octahedron we all know and love).  The end goal of this logo is to fit alongside the existing Ethereum graphics while conveying many of the keywords in the brief.

![vyper examples](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5672810/39392059-7b416c80-4a7c-11e8-8c09-c774042cabd9.png)

Vectors and assets will be made available upon request, I look forward to feedback!

As an aside, Ethereum has a nice set of [brand guidelines](https://www.ethereum.org/images/logos/Ethereum_Visual_Identity_1.0.0.pdf) and I would strongly suggest that whatever logo is eventually chosen / created should be designed to fit within the existing set.
Fantastic submissions so far!!! Thank you so much :)

Hello everyone, here is my contribution

![vyper](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38763205/39424163-985cba0e-4c75-11e8-974c-fd4d5db65092.jpg)

![vyperport](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/552529/39471338-8cb73c2e-4cf7-11e8-9931-c254319d6dee.jpg)
![vyper](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/552529/39471346-95bbed7e-4cf7-11e8-8762-45d014173f4b.png)
![vypr](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/552529/39471355-9fdecfd8-4cf7-11e8-91da-46861557164e.jpeg)

some vyper logos already exist
@debragail that is correct. Vyper the Programming language may obviously not have too similar logo (that could be mistaken for copyright infringement).
![vyper_log](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/552529/39471873-88b44b3c-4cfa-11e8-9dd6-3d39d73cc1fc.png)
a mean lil python
![screenshot from 2018-05-01 22-08-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/227698/39475920-be896ef8-4d8c-11e8-9896-cba30b3633a1.png)

![Initial](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/vyper-1.jpg)

The logo is a a combination of `lambda` and `less than` (< + Œª) which resembles a viper snake mouth with a forked tongue, using emerald green `#50c878`. The logo uses the same title font as the ethereum branding, but the logo symbol design differs from the ethereum and solidity one.

![Contrast](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/vyper-2.jpg)

Alternative contrast options for light and dark backgrounds.

![Alts](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/vyper-3.jpg)

The logo is versatile and can easily be adjusted to match different styles if necessary as the context changes.

![Layout](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/vyper-4.jpg)

This image shows the layout of the logo in both horizontal and vertical format.

![Retro](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/vyper-5.jpg)

A retro logo for fun :P it just need's some chrome text...
Love the creativity @tao!

Cool, this was my alternate idea but it's a bit harder to get the vertical logo right because the symbol is taller - so it might not work at smaller sizes, maybe some one else can play around with the idea a bit and see what comes out, or I'll have to spend some more time and clean it up a bit later on.

![Alternative](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tao/viper-logo/master/viper-alt.jpg)
@yanncarlier This is the most "friendly" logo IMO. Cheers.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/854789/39561246-5aa82b7c-4e59-11e8-9b37-12e32ae863f2.png)

![b35793a7-70c5-4b6f-a138-d1ee3100b28e](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/776519/39667991-82670758-5090-11e8-8c08-03dbe7f2cea0.jpeg)

Submission from @dimarconicola art director at [Dexlab](https://github.com/dexlab-io/Organization/).

We used the Ethereum Visual Identity guidelines as a reference for this logo.

The Icon shows a snake nested in a Ethereum-like diamond shape.

The font used and the size proportion between the graphic element and font are the same as indicated by the official guidelines.

Assets will be shared upon request.
Looking forward to hearing your feedback!

Here is my submission, designer at [Dexlab](https://github.com/dexlab-io/Organization/).

Tried to recreate a snake with ethereum basic shapes, the font is a Roboto light following the official guidelines. Also added a possible gradient version.

Open to feedback & suggestions!

![vyper logo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34310821/39673423-283c8cc4-513c-11e8-84fe-56f012dbd128.jpg)
![vyper logo colored](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34310821/39673424-28567c1a-513c-11e8-942c-e3c8851e3b75.jpg)

![vyper_logo-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14868690/39741278-0205ef42-5235-11e8-8171-a1b63da862f8.png)


I'll produce a production quality version by June 1st if it starts getting the votes.

Thoughts: 

1.   A programming language will be platform agnostic with time, so I ignored the Ethereum identity 
     guidelines.

2. I did pay tribute to the language's history: 
        a) Ethereum - eyes 
        b) Python - Flux regular font (amended)

3.  The emerald color was inspired by: 

       a) the color of the Guinness Emerald one of the largest and most valuable uncut emeralds
          (i.e. in Alpha like Vyper)
           [https://bit.ly/2JURIVG](url)

       b) the color of the green pit viper
           [https://bit.ly/2jAy0n2](url)
           
       c) I'm from Ireland (the Emerald Isle) and Guinness is a staple :)
           I also just found out the the origin of the "Emerald Isle" was from a poem 
           called "When Erin first Rose" which also mentions a serpent.
           [https://bit.ly/2jAECS0](url)

4.    The blockchain is becoming so corporate and serious that I thought something a little "tongue in 
      cheek" is more appropriate to the free spirit of coding.

I'd like to think it's friendly. 

Best, 

Paul

P.s. Only bounty I want is Vyper Lessons

Just over 2 weeks to go! Here are the current standings:
1. @dimarconicola - 29 votes
2. @Shrinks99 - 27 votes
3. @gbonumore - 26 votes

Introduce your friends to Vyper so we can get more votes from our community members!
